result.execSummary:
The defendant Reuben M CONTRERAS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Winnebago County Clerk of Circuit Court

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. Zero credit.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No Intoxicants.   Defendant shall Submit to Random Urinalysis.  No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia. Do not enter or work in establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  No contact with victim or victim's family or their employment and residence.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.

Fine and costs to be paid at time of sentencing, unless payment arrangements are approved.  Payment plans are available in the Clerk of Courts office.  Send payments to:  Clerk of Courts, Room 110, 415 Jackson Street, P O Box 2808, Oshkosh WI  54903-2808 Do NOT pay Probation Agent. Debts older than 90 days will be processed for civil judgment and sent to the Department of Revenue for collection including tax intercept. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
No good time with credit as listed below. Huber granted AFTER 9 MONTHS, if in compliance with jail facility regulations.  Defendant currenly in the Winnebago County Jail. 
Defendant shall submit DNA sample before being released from Winnebago County Jail.
